title: Comparing OpenID Connect with OAuth 2.0
content: OpenID Connect (OIDC) and OAuth 2.0 are two popular protocols you can use for authorization and authentication on the web. Both protocols allow users to securely access resources, but they work in different ways and have different use cases. In this tutorial, weâ€™ll compare OIDC and OAuth 2.0 to help you understand the key differences ...  The post appeared first on .
